> The diff coverage is `n/a`.

[Continue to review full report at Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/rocketmq/pull/2073?src=pr&el=continue).
> **Legend** - [Click here to learn more](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/codecov-delta)
> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/rocketmq/pull/2073?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [b6307df...a7904be](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/rocketmq/pull/2073?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

> maybe you should close the vip channel,detail can see [Apache RocketMQ单机部署](https://liangyuanpeng.github.io/post/2018-11-27-rocketmq%E7%8E%AF%E5%A2%83%E6%90%AD%E5%BB%BA/)
> 
> rocket除了9876其实还有两个端口
> 10911
> 10909
> 
> 10909是VIP通道对应的端口，在JAVA中的消费者对象或者是生产者对象中关闭VIP通道即可无需开放10909端口
> 
> 使用如下方法
> `setVipChannelEnabled(false);`
> 详细的可以看看[Apache RocketMQ单机部署](https://liangyuanpeng.github.io/post/2018-11-27-rocketmq%E7%8E%AF%E5%A2%83%E6%90%AD%E5%BB%BA/)

 `setVipChannelEnabled(false);`解决问题了，搞了三四个小时，各种设置，官网的demo也不说一声，有点坑啊。
fixed
https://github.com/apache/rocketmq/blob/master/docs/cn/operation.md
LGTM. Can u resolve the conflicts above？

这个场景还是比较常用啊，，大多数学习MQ的人基本不怎么学习sh的使用，上来基本就是用java client api进行开发，常常需要查看java client api执行后对应的sh命令啊，，使java代码和sh有对应的关系。
I request a another issue  #2085 since I find this feature is still not supported for the latest release @zhouxinyu @vongosling

@YuShanMuGong  Yes, this is only effective for concurrently service, since it is most popular. For orderly consume service, it may be different since it does not redeliever so it is not included in this pr
@duhenglucky  would you please help to review this pr?

@YuShanMuGong becaurce for orderly service, it is totally different. If we discard the message, order consuming will be broken since the next message may dependent on the previous message successfully consumed. Thus, in the case of order consumer service, the default value will be max value.

> putMessagePositionInfoWrapper

Message stored in CommitLog, reputMessageService put message to ConsumeQueue from its maxPhysicalPosInLogicQueue at init stage. So it will not discard message, even if reputMessageService thread crash. reputMessageService thread catch mostly exception, it rarely carsh.

> The subscription relationship must be consistent among all consumers in the consumer group.

Do you mean only support one consumer group subscribes one topic ?
Don't support one consumer group subscribes three topics at the same time ?

The first thing you should be aware of is that different Consumer Group can consume the same topic independently, and each of them will have their own consuming offsets. Of course, the consumers in the same consumer group can also consume multiple topics at the same time. Please make sure each Consumer within the same Group to subscribe to the same topics.

如果搭建集群，所有的实例都向同一个nohup.out文件输出？内容是不是会出现混乱？感谢，如何避免呢?

IMHO， nohup.out stores low-value log outputs (stdout). Usually developers would use logs only for debugging purposes, but maybe in some extreme cases developers might want to use nohup.out to debug.

> 如果搭建集群，所有的实例都向同一个nohup.out文件输出？内容是不是会出现混乱？感谢，如何避免呢?

I'm not sure what would happen here, but I  would assume in cluster mode, each node would output to the nohup.out on each node instead of printing to one nohup.out. (Like nohup.out would be local to each node). But I'm not sure about this.



Even if they output to one nohu[.out file (which is unlikely), because we rarely use it to debug, it is acceptable. On the other hand, because we are not sure if developers will use nohup.out or not, we decide to keep it just in case.

> 只用log不可以吗？？nohup.out为什么要创建？这两者有什么区别呢？

nohup.out is the nohup command default stdout output file. you can redirect to `/dev/null` . `nohup xxxx  >/dev/null`
doing this

Yeah, users can decide to mute the nohup output if they want, rocketmq choose to keep it by default and users can choose to keep it or not.

I think here( -1000 - this.getRefCount()) probably means : it just want to set the refCount to a negative value indicating a  shutdown. (-1000) is just a "negative enough" number that guarantees the result (-1000 - this.getRefCount()) will always be negative. How do you think ?
Sorry but maybe it would be helpful for us to investigate if you can provide more detailed description （can be in English or Chinese）of the bug , like steps to reproduce, expected behaviour.

I investigated the problem, I think it is not blocked, but related to some stdout overwrite issue.

The line you saw `nohup: 忽略输入并把输出追加到'nohup.out'` is not blocking, but overwriting your next prompt line..

When you see
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22848576/84849076-21102080-b087-11ea-82f4-9d593fc7d5b6.png)

It is not blocking, and you can type commands like `ls`, and it goes like

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22848576/84849115-34bb8700-b087-11ea-9b4c-d16643c2143b.png)

So this is just some weird bash overwriting problem, it looks like blocked but actually not. When you press Ctrl+C it just create a new prompt line for you.

BTW, could you do me a favor providing me a link  where people discuss this problem as you mentioned you saw a lot of discussions , maybe we can answer this question once and for all？ Thanks
